Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a Downtown Seattle getaway..........”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: My cousin told me about The Moore, and I'm happy she did. My Husband and I needed an affordable place to stay while visiting the Seattle area. Pulled up to the curb, easy for unloading. The lobby was retro, with lovely furniture, and the desk gal was friendly and super sweet. We checked out a couple rooms, and decided to upgrade, which was not a problem. The nice down comforters and folded stuffed animal towels made the place even nicer. We had dinner in the lounge, and it was fabulous. They even have juke box and pool tables. Starbucks in right down the street, and we visited the public market, which was two blocks away. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you want to be near the Public Market and City Center. Everything was in walking distance. Parking wasn't a problem either. They have a deal with a garage within walking distance. So we took advantage of that for our two night stay. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: tulsatravelbum
Reviews.Content: I chose the Moore Hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was very pleased with my choice. I wanted a hotel that I could get to easily by rail from the airport, and the Moore fit the bill. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Our room had a bit of a view of Pikes Market and the waterfront. The front desk is extremely helpful, Robert and Tracy were awesome! They helped with bus schedules, restaurant recommendations, and loads of general Seattle information. The room was a bit chilly, but the front desk was quick to offer extra blankets, so we were very comfortable. Even though the rooms do not have a small refrigerator, I bought some cheese at Pikes that the staff was kind enough to store for a couple of days in their refrigerator :-) We were not interested in a hotel with a fitness center or big restaurant, so the Moore was a great option for saving a bit on the room rate so we could enjoy more activities. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and I will stay there again. Another tip - consider buying the Seattle City Pass!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jen J
Reviews.Content: I read thNe reviews, saw the location and price and decided that booking a room here was a good idea. My advice:don't do it people, just don't. Go for a brand name hotel, and pay a little more. That way, if something goes horribly wrong, you may have a shot at getting some kind of resolution. This is a true story, swear to God: my husband went to wipe himself off with a towel-twice while taking a shower and both of the towels had fe..s on them. Yes, fe..s. He flipped out and took the towels to the front desk. The manager was not there, and upon checking out, I explained to the girl at the front desk that not only was this appalling, but dangerous. Particularly to my one month old baby. I also told her, that I did not feel like I should pay for our stay there. I did pay though (Dumb. In retrospect, I should not have), because I just thought I would settle this with the manager later. My thought was the manager would listen to what happened to us, and act appropriately. That didn't happen. I emailed "Mike", the manager, then followed up with a phone call. He basically called m a liar, said that "never in my career have I ever heard of something like this", to which I replied, "Well I haven't heard of anything like this either in all my years of traveling, but this really did happen." He then proceeded to give me the third degree about where the towels were located, when this happened blah blah, etc. It was very apparent that he felt that this was some creative attempt on my family's part to get a refund. God, what a jerk. I am POed all over again just writing this. I asked for a refund, he said no, then I told him that I would need to file a complaint with the BBB. He then said, "Go ahead! I don't care, you can threaten me all you want!" Uh, no Mike this isn't personal, just horrendous customer service. Like, on very level imaginable. Whatever. I told him, fine. If this is the way you choose to handle this. I filed a complaint w/the BBB. come to think of it, I think I'll contact The Health Department too.

Reviews.Title: “Read the fine print”
Reviews.Author: BrokenPants
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a concert next door. That is very convenient. The parking issue is a royal pain in the butt and I thought there must be internet or something in the lobby because it always seemed full in the morning (no internet elsewhere its just an old building) but discovered Sunday morning everyone was sitting around because the parking garage didn't open until 9am. Glad I didn't have to be anywhere! Booked months in advance and was in for a rude surprise then we checked out and they tried to charge significantly more than the agreed price. There is another place nearby with significantly more to offer for much less but I dig "historic". I don't dig surprises. Eventually the manager made good but it was after I got home. The restaurant next door turned the music up LOUD one night as if to tell my group GET OUT as soon as we sat down. That was fine, there's an Irish pub on the back side of the block (not the douchey one down by the market place) that had excellent food at excellent prices and the nicest staff we've ever encountered in downtown Seattle. If the other place hadn't chased us off we'd never have found the good place. The Moore doesn't even know what the word amenity means. What you get is a very clean room with a small TV and in our case a great view. There is nothing else, no fridge, coffee or microwave. The cleaning staff is terrific (cleaned our room twice one day which was funny and sweet). It was November so it was cold. There is no A/C and we don't think the heat ever came on in the 3 days we were there. Waking up at the crack of dawn and searching for breakfast was quite the adventure. The coffee shop next door (adjacent to the lobby) is terrific. The new owners are great. It kept the cloying damp at bay and prevented me from melting down when I discovered our car was being held hostage after we'd moved all our stuff downstairs and given up the room key. The theater next door is a great venue but the hotel was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: StacyH13
Reviews.Content: Although I had lived in Seattle for 13 years, I had no idea that the Moore Hotel was this lovely! Perfect central location right in the heart of downtown Seattle - made walking to the best places & meeting up with friends easy. I was traveling with my 6 mo old baby & they put us in a GREAT room that was wonderfully spacious with a kitchenette & dining area. Such a pleasant departure from the homogenous chain hotels & great value too. Room was quiet & clean & the staff were the best. Very helpful in every way & knowledgeable about everything from local sites to good music, books & movies! Have already reccomended The Moore to several friends & would absolutely stay there again. You needn't look anywhere else. I looked everywhere & this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: LIVINGlifewithGI
Reviews.Content: The first experience of this place was great, it was the young guy on the front desk he was the most genuin nicest guy and just really wanted to help us, so we checked in we had a private room with own bathroom it was good size and clean and comfortable, the value is great for the price. It's only a couple of blocks away from main street of shop and wharf also a couple of block each way from the nicer restaurants. As I said earlier what really makes this place is the young guy on front desk he really made our stay we would ask him anything and he would be genuinly happy to answer and told us about some of the best restaurants I've ever been too.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Great!”
Reviews.Author: heavyastronaut
Reviews.Content: It's the only place I stay in Seattle. It's in the middle of downtown which is pretty awesome. It's an old, crusty hotel so you have to like that sort of thing. Very popular with budget travellers that don't mind paying just a little more than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Economy Stay, Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: OceanloverBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice, one night each time - first to attend a music concert at Nordstrom's Benaroya Hall and second for a soccer game at (formerly QWEST Field but now called) CenturyLink Stadium. We knew that it was going to be extremely basic accommodation so we weren't disappointed. Being as central as it was it was a quick walk to the Public Market or to shops such as Macy's. The rooms are spotless and adequate for a no-frills stay. Given that all buses in the downtown core are FREE 24/7 there is the option of taking a bus to/from any downtown destination.Because the weather was so nice we walked to the soccer game and back. It is quite a distance so one would want comfortable walking shoes to do so. I was surprised to see how the area around the Public Market seemed to roll up the carpets by 9pm, hardly anything open to go for an after-game beverage/dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla d
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver BC so we always go down to Seattle for concerts and ball games. This hotel is my favorite to stay in for these group outings. It's about $100 per night for 2 double beds, the rooms are clean and comfortable and there's a private bathroom with shower.The hotel itself is old and has a lot of character. It's in a great location with tons of stuff to do in the neighborhood. Not too far away from Pike Place Market, the Aquarium, Safeco or Qwest stadiums which makes it easy to get home after a game, walkable if you're not in a rush and have an extra 30-40 min to stroll. They don't have parking at the hotel, but they do have a discounted rate for a parking garage a block and a half away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown Seattle we were able to leave our car parked for most of our visit. We were within walking distance to Pike Place, great shopping and restaurants. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we went to eat and it still was not ready when we got back. I would advise letting the staff know if you will be arriving at check in time so your room will be ready. The room was clean, the staff friendly. Our only problem was no air conditioner, Seattle was having unusually warm weather and we had to attempt to sleep with the windows open. This was difficult because of the location, nightclubs, sirens and garbage pick up very early. I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget. It was very reasonably priced and has a lot of history. And check out the painting on the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Moore for 3 nights. We walked to Pike's Place Market daily (2 blocks away) we walked to the Space Needle (about 10 blocks away) and would walk to breakfast and dinner daily. Our room was recently remodeled, we had a view of Elliot's Bay and it was gorgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ninama3
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Couldn't have been better. A few blocks from almost everything - including two of the best restaurants we visited (Serious Pie & Dahlia Lounge), Pike Place Market, the monorail to the city centre and downtown. Some shouting and sirens at night on the weekend. ROOMS Super basic rooms take this hotel from great to average. The room itself is a good size with enough closet space and drawers. Linens were clean. There is no heater in the room - when we went it wasn't too cold though I'd imagine in the dead of winter this could be an issue. We only had one night stand which was kind of annoying. The bathroom is tiny - REALLY TINY. Impossible to take a shower - it's so narrow that when you turn the shower on, the water sprays clear past the curtain. STAFF Friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shlee_Monkee
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel just blocks from great restaurants and stores. We got in very late and got a room quickly; we found a reasonably priced and very clean room with good views of the city below. Lobby and hall decoration was what I would call funky classic. Toilet was across the hall but wasn't inconvenient. Front desk was super helpful when we left looking for a restaurant that we didn't know the name of; she found it on Google and printed out maps for us.

Reviews.Title: “This is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mrkstd11
Reviews.Content: Absolutely well located, a few blocks from downtown Seattle, a few blocks from the Public Market, this Hotel has excellent service, great and spacious rooms, clean and comfortable. Wi-fi was also working in my room. Not to mention the Moore Coffee, a small and beaultiful coffee shop just for you. If you are going to Seattle, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good first impression of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: randyram
Reviews.Content: Great central location. We could not get wifi in the room but it was available in the lobby. My only quibbble was the elevator which you would not call a modern or high speed elevator. However I was rarely inconvenienced by the elevator during our four day stay. Would deifintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, cool, clean, friendly, sheik”
Reviews.Author: Jennafah
Reviews.Content: The Moore hotel is awesome. You can't beat the value and the rooms are boutiquey and vintage. Lots of style. The staff rocks as does the location. Best bet in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: berkeley78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at The Moore. The location gave us good access to Pike Market, Belltown cafes as well as LINK and bus transportation. The hotel is not air-conditioned but that was not a factor in our stay. The desk personnel were very helpful with all our questions (like restaurant recommendations). We were pleased with the room service staff and the overall cleanliness of the hotel. Our rate (for a suite) was about half the standard room rate at other hotels we considered. We stayed a week and this was a good choice. You just have to be willing to do without amenities like a pool, exercise room, wi-fi, bell hops, in-house coffee shop and the like. The TV was small. Berkeley78

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, excellent location, great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: dean C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in September after the hotel was recommended by a friend. the staff were friendly, helpful and full of information when we checked in. We asked for a room with good wifi signal so they placed us on floor one which was really thoughtful of them. Although the rooms are a little out dated they are very very big, clean and comfortable, we had a walk in closet, and a great tv. We had a basin in the room and acces to a shared bathroom,however the bathroom was always vacant and regularly cleaned.The shower was powerful and perfect temperature.. The location was superb and within walking distance to all sight seeing spots, as well as close by to restaurants, bars, and shops. The bar next door nitelite is great for happy hour and a game of pool, $2 a beer. I would definitely stay here again, thank you for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation to return.”
Reviews.Author: Time2SeeItAll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and we greeted with pleasant staff and a clean hotel. The location is excellent, albeit on top of a hill - but Seattle is a very hilly place! The room was extremely quiet as we requested a room away from the street, and it was very clean. We slept with the windows open and couldn't hear a thing all night! For the price, we'd certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, fantastic service, amazing room but noisy guests.”
Reviews.Author: djwgilroy
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay would have been perfect if the sorority girls who frequent the hotel weren't quite so "vocal" when getting busy at night. If it wasn't for the four martinis I wouldn't have been able to sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “big room, good location”
Reviews.Author: masi76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a big room on the 5th floor with private bath. It was a bit noisy because the window faced the street but the beds were very comfortable. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and knowlegable. WiFi didn´t work in our room, but at least in the entrance hall. Location is excellent, about 2 blocks from the Public Market, food and shopping facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Greater Location!”
Reviews.Author: JChil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renovated and our room was very clean and comfortable. There was a bit of noise from the concert going on in the theatre, but hardly noticeable on the fifth floor. You can hear it more in the bathroom but since I don't sleep in there it was of no concern. The room was very modern and we had a claw foot tub in our bathroom. The only downsides are that there was no mini fridge or microwave in the room and since the building is ols so is the plumbing. The water temp tended to fluctuate a bit during showers, but nothing uncomfortable. As far as the frige and the microwave go, we ate everything fresh from restaurants and the market. The fridge would have been nice to keep drinks in the room cold, but we just filled out ice bucket up and kept them cozy in it. Overall the hotel was much more than I hoped for. Very friendly staff are at the counter 24/7 and they can recommend some great local eateries. Now on the the location. It's 2 blocks from the market! Seeing as most everything we did was there it was super convenient. What was farther (Space Needle, EMP Museum) we took the monorail. It's in the Westlake Center (1-2 blocks away) and ends right beside the Space Needle. It's $2 one way and it takes 90 seconds. When you're running late for a tour because you've spent too much time lingering in the museum it's a very nice option. Totally worth the 2 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HeathAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week for work in Queen rooms with private bath. It is great location and Robert at the front desk was a brilliant source of local knowledge. Beds were comfortable, rooms nice and clean, loved the tiger strip carpet on our floor. Only negatives would be the shower had really poor pressure and temperature. There was no wi-fi on our floor which was a pain as we were there for work, so we spent a lot of time in the lobby. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB location, staff so friendly, rooms are big,clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jenvive
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend and we are so pleased we booked it. We are a young couple on a budget travelling around the USA for 6 months, this hotel is excellent value for money. Upon check in the staff were more than welcoming, offering tips and info about the city, they also let us stay in a room with better wifi signal as I had to do some work whilst staying here. Our room was HUGE, comfy, clean, nice big closet and a nice view. Tons and tons of tv channels and wifi signal was superb. We had a basin in the room and acces to a shared bathroom, the bathroom was always available, and clean. The shower was powerful and lovely and warm. The best part about this hotel is the location, walking distance to EVERYTHING, brilliant spot in the city. The bar next door nitelite is great for happy hour and a game of pool, $2 a beer. I would definitely stay here again, thank you for a brilliant few days.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic, funky hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: complexions
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Seattle, Washington with family at the Moore Hotel. I'm not really sure if you'd consider it a boutique hotel, as it has a lot of rooms, but it is rather quaint and not easily found on typical internet searches of Seattle hotels. We stayed in two rooms (4 people) with an adjoining bathroom. Interesting, but functional. The rooms were a decent size with big windows. We were blocks from the light rail station (which we took from the Sea/Tac airport) and blocks from the Pike Place Market. Its not located in the upscale part of town, but well within walking distance of many tourist attractions. The hallways are long and very dark, but the lobby is bright and cheery! There is one centralized computer in the lobby for guest use. The newly opened, attached coffee shop (Moore Coffee) with free wi-fi, is delightful. My only complaint, and its a big one, only one mirror. No mirrors in either bedroom and one small mirror in the bathroom. We requested more mirrors, even a hand held mirror, nothing available! Very difficult for getting ready in the morning, especially for four women. I would however, stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We would never stay here again, pay more and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: beenthere088
Reviews.Content: VERY old hotel (we normally love old buildings), Bad part of town, local cops told us it is a no-go area after 6.30pm and they were right. Homeless people everywhere in this area. No tea making facilities, No Aircon, No Fridge, filthy room (thanks for the pair of ladies panties laying in the middle of the room). Noisy, No Parking, No restaurant. The bad hotel in a 5 week trip. Pay the money and stay elsewhere. p.s. I tried to tell the full story on this place but Trip advisor refused to print it. Read my other reviews and see how my reviews are truthful and accurate and generous.

Reviews.Title: “Moore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moore Hotel 6 nights during a recent visit to Seattle. It is an older hotel, with some remodeling done, and it was very clean. The best part about staying at the Moore is Location, location, location! It is in walking distance to Pike's Market, the waterfront, and great restaurants! The lack of air conditioning was a bit of a surprise but then I learned nearly all of Seattle doesn't have a/c, but they provided a fan. (IT was very warm the week we were there.) The shower is small, but durable. If you are looking for a place that is clean and close to major attractions, I highly recommend this place. The staff was awesome also!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, classic and a tad bit spooky!”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: The Moore is one of Seattle's two truly historic hotels and is a great deal for downtown Seattle. I checked in at midnight and got one of the less desirable rooms, tucked away int he back overlooking the alley. It had a private bathroom with a non functional shower and no mirror and in the morning we woke to some insanely loud construction type activity in the alley. That said, I would definitely recommend the Moore... Everyone we interacted with was friendly, the maintenance guys even took my boyfriend and I down to check out the Olympic size swimming pool in the basement (it's empty)! Positives: -Super central location -Minimal, modern guest rooms -Very affordable -Laid back and likable employees Negatives: You can't have visitors in some rooms Not all rooms have private baths 11am checkout Slow elevators All in all a great old hotel, and the only one with rooms available the night of the Yankees game this month!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tink3604
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Moore hotel. The location is perfect, close to all the major attractions in Seattle. We requested a newly renovated room, yet the hotel room still had an older feel, with a claw foot tub, a big door with an old door knob, etc. I loved walking down the stairs and seeing how all of the hallways had been done differently, yet they are all equally beautiful. The front desk was friendly and available 24 hours a day. Though both nights we stayed at The Moore, there were two different concerts, right next door at The Moore theater. The music and vibrations were heard and felt only partially through the room, but did not disturb us in the slightest. The only complaint I have is the water pressure in the shower was awful! And the temperature kept changing through out my shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Mehilainen
Reviews.Content: Moore hotel was good for the money. Room was big, bathroom was spacious with cute towel-animals. Walk-in-closet was nice suprise. wifi didn't really work anywhere else except next to the base station and at the lobby. Rooms are quiet, clean, spacious and beds are comfy and location works. And thats what you pay for when coming to Moore. Those needing extra might not be happy..

Reviews.Title: “Still great after all these years”
Reviews.Author: JB-Global
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Moore Hotel in 1996, 2001, 2006, and now again just recently in 2011. I'm happy to say it is still great. Excellent, central location for a very reasonable price. The service at the front desk has always been courteous, helpful, and friendly. The rooms and the entire interior, though basic, are very charming and clean. There's a clawfoot tub in the room, but the plumbing is completely modern, and is as good or better as other upscale hotels I have reserved. I have to think hard to find something negative to say. The shower curtain in my room was a bit musty, but opening the window quickly and completely eradicated the scent. As many have said, there's no air conditioning, but I can only imagine this being an issue on maybe 5 nights a year, during an unusual heat wave. And the street noise (especially on a Friday or Saturday night) is audible. But unless you are really sensitive about any of those 3 things, I'd highly recommend The Moore...I think you will find it will actually be a fondly memorable aspect of a visit to Seattle, a city with many attractions and things to be fond of.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel...great experience!”
Reviews.Author: NiCoLe8275
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Moore Hotel for 5 nights in early June. The price and location are fantastic. This hotel is within walking distance to many attractions including the market, ferry to Bainbridge Island, art museums, shopping and countless restaurants (including the dahlia bakery--trust me, you need the triple coconut cream pie). Keep in mind that the Moore is an old building. The rooms are simple, neat, clean and have a bit of character (wood trim). The windows look out onto the street, but never was I disturbed by street traffic. The desk staff are incredibly helpful, have good recommendations and are willing to do a bit of searching to help you navigate the city. There is also an attached bar, the Nitelite. This place is fantastic for people watching, attracts an eclectic crowd and has local beer. What more could you ask for? I highly recommend the Moore, a Seattle must!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and experience”
Reviews.Author: taace1i1a
Reviews.Content: It was nice to stay in this hotel because it's in a great location, it's a decent price, and the hotel itself is fun to wander around in. It's two blocks from the pikes market, and three blocks from the mall, about 8 blocks from museums and the needle. The rooms were ver clean, and though the note, is old it's well-kept. Everybody at the desk was extremely friendly and helpful!! There is wifi, but it doesn't work in most of the rooms. However there is a co pry, breezy lobby you can go to. There are a few cons though. There is no AC, and there was one little window to open so you could barely get a breeze. I stayed in early September and it was decent at 80 degrees. It's just hard to get to sleep at night when it's so warm. The only other con is that there's no parking. They do have a deal with the Macy's parking structure. Block away though. 24 hours is usually 30 bucks, but it's only 12 with the voucher. All in all it was a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the Moore...and the location was the best!”
Reviews.Author: HrComsTrbl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the hotel for one night. I enjoy older hotels with some history, and thought the Moore Hotel was beautiful! It was very reasonable, especially considering the location. There were 4 of us sharing a room. The rooms were clean, had a nice view, and there was enough room for all of us. We were on the 6th floor, and didn't have a problem with the noise. The windows opened, and there was a small fan, which was fine for us, but if it was hot, the room would have been hot. Fortunately Seattle doesn't get that hot! The service was great...and we asked them quite a few questions about the area! They did everything that they could to answer our many questions!!! I was surprised by the complaints about the service, however, I believe that the way you treat people...comes back to you. There were so many options for eating within walking distance. I loved being so close to Pike Place Market!!! Had fun at the Nitelite bar next door too! It was a local bar feel, and he bartender was great! I would stay at the Moore Hotel again, if I get to visit this lovely city again!

Reviews.Title: “THE budget hotel choice in the Northwest”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before. They charge 74 dollars vs over 150 at every other hotel downtown. Steps to Pike Place Market. Not far from transit options. Large ceilings and rooms that open. I had Room 700 facing Macys which was very quiet. Rooms clean as a whistle. Fans in room since A-C rarely needed in Seattle. Neighborhood sketch at night. Nearvy Cafe d'Arte has great coffee drinks. Walk down one block to First Avenue for a selection of great Belltown Restaurants. If you are a frugal traveller, you will like the Moore. Otherwise pay the 200+ plus per night and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Elaine827
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, so close to Pike Place Market. However, it was loud if you stay in a room facing the street. We were on 7th floor and still could hear loud noises from the street throughout the night. Not only that, you can hear your neighbor's TV so the wall must be really thin. The room was okay, quite roomy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL stay - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: b6601
Reviews.Content: First - this is the MOST economical choice for Seattle lodging! Believe me, I looked for SEVERAL months before booking here! Building is historical (old) but rooms are nice. Bed was comfortable and sheets clean and smell fresh (what a HUGE change from other hotels)! Bathroom was nicely appointed and had a towel animal 'greeter' ... that was fun - no longer reserved for cruise ships! Water was HOT and water pressure was GREAT (another HUGE change from other hotels)! Staff is WONDERFUL. They know Seattle and can and will point you in the right direction for food, sights, etc. They DO provide soap and shampoo - but if you need/want a hair dryer, bring your own (they might have one at front desk but I didn't ask). Biggest 'negative' is NO A/C. They do provide a small bedside fan but I happened to have brought my own. I can imagine during the summer the rooms would be hot - so plan accordingly!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great for Budget Travel”
Reviews.Author: angela369
Reviews.Content: I always find it a bit tough reviewing hotels of this class...no matter how good a 'deal' it is I can't give it better than an average rating since esthetically they are obviously challenged. So...IF you want a deal in one of the best locations in Seattle and don't care about esthetics (or air conditioning) then I'd highly recommend this place. I was there on one of the hottest weekends of the summer so the rooms was quite hot and stuffy without a/c but I know that's a non-issue for 80% of the rest of the year. I stayed in #210 which is right above the Dive Bar...not recommended. It was a massive room though and thank God we had our own bathroom! And they also kindly gave me a deal because of it's location - very nice of them. I hadn't realized when I booked that some rooms don't have their own bathrooms...you have to use the ones in the hallway. Again, personal preference I guess but that's a deal breaker for me. The room was clean, and that's the most important thing to me. But it's also very old and dated and we had a huge crack in the bathroom wall where part of the wall was literally peeling off. The lobby is very nice and also the only updated portion of the hotel and the front desk staff are some of the friendliest/most helpful I've met anywhere. Also, booking the reservation over the phone was a pleasure. The parking is a steal at $12/day a block away. Amazing location one block away from the market and 3 blocks from main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “I almost want to keep this my secret !”
Reviews.Author: skipper5150
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of place I almost don't want to tell the rest of the world about. Very affordable and just the basics that you need for a mid-scale urban pedestrian martini-fuelled safari!. The Moore is basically a 100 year old hotel that has been maintained nicely, but not redecorated to keep up with the fashions....it's all nice and clean - no fancy amenities, no bar fridges, no pool or hot-tubs, etc. Our plan was to park the car ( this part is a little tricky) walk to Pike's Place Market, have a great seafood meal (Cutter's - great but not cheap) hit the local pubs - a little jazz or blues....it all worked out perfecto! What we saved on the hotel paid for half the meal...the room had a great view (8th floor facing the ocean) no balcony but huge windows (that open - so careful with kids!!) So close to so many great sites....downtown Seattle is the best walking place!! And the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: GirlFriday24
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Moore. It is the best deal for downtown Seattle hotels, including the parking voucher which allows you to park in a garage a block away for $12 a day. The hotel doesn't have a lot in terms of "extras" like fitness rooms or breakfast, but it more than makes up for that in cost, location and friendly staff. We stayed in mid-August and never felt too hot in our room and we slept VERY comfortably. The Moore is just a quick walk to the Market, bus lines and other downtown attractions, and it has a lovely/super affordable Vietnamese restaurant (Long) right across the street if you find yourself hungry upon check-in!

Reviews.Title: “THE MOORREEEEE”
Reviews.Author: xbabiegurlx
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during BC Canada long weekend in August. Pike Market 2 blocks away, if you looing for a budget place anything go to the MOORE (especially in the summer as it is high season). Most COMFY beds ever. Simple rooms, clean. convenient location and spacious. The Lobby is very artistic modern looking. Really nice Front Desk Agents. Elevator is small which i found funny and cute. Each floors have their own theme i believe as i was on the 6th floor and the carpet was leopartd print kinda exotic and when we took the stairs the floor below us was more modern theme. Bathrooms are clean and they made this bunny made out of the towels. TV is a bit out dated but hey we're there for Seattle not TV. I'll definitely come back. Pro: - VERY comfy beds, might be memory foam or it feels that way - Good location, 2 blocks from Pike Market, walking distance from restaurants, shopping, the Space Needle - Clean and quiet - Friendly Front Desk Agents Cons: - Parking, they dont have their own parking you have to go 1 block away or so to a parking building, to pay they do give u a discounted rate $12 for 24 hrs i believe . - No fridge, i needed it to keep water bottle cold - A/C if your staying in the summer time but they have a small fan

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm for a great price AND a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelFox10
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Pike Place Market, you'll find this little gem. And for $100/night (for a Thursday) in this area of Seattle, you'll have a hard time beating the price. This is a renovated original building, complete with real keys (versus the plastic variety). I felt like I was in an old movie when I walked off the closet sized elevator, down the hallway. It's not one of those all frills included hotels, but you will get clean linens, and basic toiletries, and excellent guest service. The bathrooms have claw foot tubs, and although the shower head was a little low for my height, the charm of the room itself made up for it. I rated the sleep quality as average related to the box spring mattress, but the room itself (on the 7th floor) was quiet. The location and the charm are two of the best features of the Moore Hotel. As long as their prices and service continue, I would pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing deal with a great staff and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Justin_and_Amanda_L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moore Hotel for 2 nights this month. We stayed in one of the queen bed rooms on one of the upper stories with a private bathroom. We were extremely impressed with the quality of our room, the price of the room, and the attention to detail in the decor. The hotel maid staff is clearly a cut above the rest: when we arrived they had folded all of our towels into the shape of different animals. They even creased the paper in the toilet paper rolls. The room was very clean and tidy. The view from our window was also excellent. We had a great view of the Puget sound and other historic downtown Seattle buildings. The bed was comfortable and we slept great. A couple other things: 1) There are men and women's restrooms on the first floor which is very convenient if you need to use the restroom while checking in or after checking out 2) They have a luggage closet where you can store your stuff if you want to continue roaming the city after you have checked out. 3) The furniture in the lounge are is very comfortable But, the absolute best thing about this hotel is..... The Location!! We were enthralled to find out that almost all of the restaurants we wanted to eat at and a lot of the things we wanted to see and do in Seattle were within a few blocks of the hotel! Perfect location for anyone visiting the city. We were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and we loved it”
Reviews.Author: drizzly7609
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel is an old hotel that has maintained its character. There were 12 of us (8 adults and 4 young adults) in 4 rooms including a suite. This worked just fine--people routinely leave their doors open and it's a friendly environment. The front desk staff were helpful and accommodating. The rooms were clean as was the entire place. There is no air conditioning but there are fans in each room and the windows open. Located within walking distance of the Pike Street Market and lots of other places. If you want first class and cookie cutter, look elsewhere. We loved it and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What "Moore" could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: bvonne22
Reviews.Content: Ok, bad pun. But, I can't say enough good things about this wonderful hotel. Considering how inexpensive and affordable it is, I wasn't expecting much. But, boy was I wrong! For starters, the hotel is only a block or two up from Pike Place Market (which I could pretty much spend all day at!). Each floor of the hotel has a different decorating theme. Rather than boring, normal hotel decor, each floor of the Moore is eccentric and fun, but not tacky. Our room was, clean, and the bed comfy, and we had a wonderful view of the Space Needle from our window. Not to mention, the awesome old Moore Theater attached to the hotel (I'm a sucker for old, classic theaters). Hotel staff was friendly, too. My boyfriend accidentally left something in the room, and they mailed it back to him after we left. I'm not sure when I'll be back in Seattle, but when I am, I know that I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful old hotel, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Theresa W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, reeling from the $500 cost of a two-night stay in a popular chain hotel in Portland, made it a point to search for a less expensive option in Seattle. We're both glad we did. The Moore Hotel was comfortable, quiet, and clean. We even had views of the Seattle Harbor from our seventh-floor room! And it cost us only $100 a night, including tax!! It was a fabulous deal. (The only drawback that we saw is that the room wasn't air-conditioned. But we were comfortable and cool regardless.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: BC-Jack63
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was priced well under most downtown Seattle hotels and had good ratings on tripadvisor. We were not confident we would like it, but in the end we were very happy with what we got. The location was excellent as it was very close to Pike Place Market. The rooms were clean and nice. Not sure you'd want to be there on a hot summer night as there is no air conditioning, but there aren't too many of those nights in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: redcape
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give this one away because I want to save this spot for my friends, family and even myself! The Moore Hotel in downtown Seattle is a GREAT DEAL! It is a few blocks from the Pike Place market, all the hip clubs and restaurants in Belltown, and also within walking distance of the Seattle Art Museum, Symphony Hall, etc. Granted, the place isn't fancy, but it doesn't need to be. The bed was comfortable, the room was good sized, and our room was quiet and clean. What more do you need? Remember to ask about the reduced parking deal for a secure garage nearby.

Reviews.Title: “close to everything”
Reviews.Author: gerwen-8
Reviews.Content: very close to pike place market, macys, restaurants, buses, link to airport. nice clean room. stayed on weekday . not noisy. desk clerk very helpful with restaurants and how to get bus. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: FlyinPup
Reviews.Content: The location is great, 2 blocks from Pike Place Market. It's an older hotel and is not fancy, but you can get 2 rooms that share a bathroom for the price of a single room anywhere else. One of the rooms had its own sink, and there was a sink, toilet and shower in the shared bathroom. The shower was pretty small, and missing a soap dish, but the water was hot and the water pressure was good. The bed was very comfortable, although the pillows were a little firmer than I like. There is a theater next door, so if a performance is going on, I'm not sure how noisy it would be; there were no shows during our stay. There was a band playing across the street one evening, fortunately they didn't go on too late, because even with the window closed it was pretty loud. The hotel has a deal with the nearby Macy's garage, you can park for $12 a day. I'm not sure if they have air conditioning, I suspect they don't, although it wasn't an issue when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Old school but location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: rallyetourist
Reviews.Content: Older hotel in a questionable neighborhood, but it is located in a very good spot. Only 2 blocks away from Pike's Market, a few blocks from Westlake Center/Downtown area, and couple blocks from the Sound Transit Link Station and free 99 bus line (for going to Pier 66 cruise terminal). You know you're in a vintage lodging when they still give out actual metal room keys instead of a key card. There was noise from the street people out on the sidewalk, but at least it stopped by midnight or so. Tiniest, slowest elevator ever seen, get used to only using the stairs. Got the queen suite (family didn't want the smaller rooms w/ shared bath) which was surprisingly spacious with a kitchenette which included a microwave and small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Andrews
Reviews.Content: I checked in to a $120 suite and at first glance it looked fine, apart from the view of the rooftop ducts and carpark. The fridge was the first issue. The ice box was broken and turned the entire fridge into a freezer. Everything I had bought from the local grocery store, after a long-haul flight from London, was frozen solid when I got up the next day. The fridge was replaced, but no apology made for the wasted food. The second issue was the WiFi. Nobody could access it. It requires a username and password. The ones supplied by the front desk were rejected. The manager came round and said the router was broken. After he appeared to have fixed it and left, the problem persisted. The third and most important issue was the desk clerk. His name is Robert and he quickly grows impatient when you report problems, blaming it on "the guest's equipment". I said that without WiFi I would need to check out, since I am on a business trip and need to access emails. His reply was "Awesome" and "Have a nice evening". After a long flight and business to conduct this is the last thing you need. I do not recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a hostel. The prices are modest, but the staff do not like dealing with problems with the room. I got the impression it is family run, with the desk staff being relatives who do not need to worry about complaints from guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Tabernash1
Reviews.Content: Great access to pike place market and harbor. Rooms average, old hotel, noisy hallways, but location makes up for it. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “location is awesome, hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: KaCe032
Reviews.Content: I hated staying in this hotel. First of all, there's a very strange building next door which I think either houses the homeless or the crazy's. There was one lady at the front desk who was nice. Otherwise the guys behind the desk are rude, punk college kids. I had several run ins with their attitudes. Also on one particular day they were cleaning the windows; the guy propped up his squeegee which ended up falling over and hitting me.The walls are really thin and I had a room by the elevator so every time someone came on and off the floor I heard it. I would never stay here again, I chose to stay in this location because it was the only affordable thing around the convention center. However on the price vs. quality comparison, it was still a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: UpstateSCRose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Moore Hotel for three nights at the beginning of a two-week vacation. We enjoyed our stay immensely--the staff were very friendly, the bed was comfortable, the room was extremely clean, the hotel is well maintained and it is very close to Pike Market, shopping, the monorail, and the aquarium. We flew into Sea-Tac and took the Link Light Rail to Westlake Station, If I had any complaints at all it would be that there are no coffee makers in the rooms and there is no coffee in the lobby (but we got great coffee, hot tea, and crumpets at the Crumpet Shop in Pike Place Market every morning). Just a note: our room had a clawfoot tub shower, which might be difficult for some people to get in and out of. I cannot comment on parking because we waited until we were leaving Seattle to pick up a rental car. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for sons and dad”
Reviews.Author: burnabytraveller
Reviews.Content: We needed a downtown Seattle hotel to sleep my two adult sons and myself so we could attend a baseball game that evening. The Moore came through with a room with a queen sized bed and a twin in one room and another queen sized bed in a second bedroom, all for a great price. The Moore is an older property but well maintained. The front desk was helpful in making dining and parking suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price...location, location,location!”
Reviews.Author: kghedin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle for 5 nights and needed something close to the action and at a reasonable price, which the Moore Hotel offers. We did arrive early to check in and were lucky enough to be able to check in immediately. The room was near the back, so it was quiet, but unfortunately no view. That was not a problem for us as we were planning to be out every day. The outside of the building definately does not do it justice, as the interior was refurbished with great style; every floor's hallway has it's unique look. The room was small compared to "normal" standards, but it was definately adequate. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was adequate as well. What really makes this place worth it is that it is within walking/public transit distance of anyplace in downtown. Parking is offered at a discount rate at a parking garage around the corner at $12 a day, which I understand is quite a bargain. If you are looking for a unique hotel with helpful staff at a great price close to what downtown Seattle has to offer, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: starfruit18
Reviews.Content: We booked in here last minute as our original plans fell through. The first night we had a room with a private bedroom. The second night, a room with a shared bathroom. Room with private bathroom Very comfortable, as this hotel is very old (has been remodeled) the rooms are large. Neat and tidy, nice bathroom with a claw foot tub. No internet access though - the wireless signal is really weak and no wired internet. Room with shared bathroom We were reluctant - but it was all that was left on such short notice. The shared bathroom was fine, never had to queue to use it. Our room was still a good size and comfortable with an incredible view over Pike place and out to Puget Sound. No internet. It's in a really good location, right downtown. We really enjoyed it. Staff were helpful, affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, mostly a good place!”
Reviews.Author: slpbball24
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was fantastic. Central in terms of downtown Seattle, and two blocks from Pike Place, which is a good starting place for anybody coming to Seattle. The room itself reflects the price you pay--not fantastic, but relatively clean and comfortable. The major problems I had were that the water temperature wasn't regulated at all--I was scalded and frozen within seconds of stepping in the shower. It was also a very small shower, which was manageable, but tough to shave in. The people at the front desk are mostly fun, but the wireless is awful everywhere except the lobby. All in all, unless the you have a ton of money to spend in Seattle, the Moore is a good value, especially as you will spend very little time in the hotel anyway, Seattle is FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean! I would say 3-1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Goodtimes039
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights sleeping at the Moore hotel. We'ed leave early in the am and return exhuasted very late. Had a great view on the seventh floor of the harbour which made the stay even that must more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hi__D33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because this is a prime location for a budget price. Looked around the internet for days and found this hotel at a great price for our one-night stay. Compared to other bigger chained hotels, this private hotel made our stay enjoyable. The bed is very comfortable and we stayed on the 5th floor, with free wireless internet access. The bathroom is very small and the shower is a little yucky but it'll do for a night's stay. Parking is not free, don't get fooled but metered parking is everywhere so if you stay on Sat/Sun, move your car around 6pm on Sat and spot a free spot and pay nothing until Monday morning. It's central to the downtown Macy's, and Pike Place Market, and Seattle Center. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decidedly funky”
Reviews.Author: Fleecebrain
Reviews.Content: Someone put a lot of thought into restoring this place built 100 years ago and squarely in the middle of downtown Seattle. A bit hard to access in traffic. The rooms are very simple with few amentities. Claw foot tub is hard to get into for older folks and didn't seal for a bath, just a shower. Bottom line..OK for one night when you have to be close to the ball park, but not quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: kypata3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located....close to many restaurants, Pike Place Market, etc. We walked to Pioneer Place with no problem. Our room was nicely furnished, very clean and quiet. I am a single parent travelling with my young child and would stay at The Moore again without hesitation. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Moore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fernwoodtk
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel is cozy, clean, comfy beds, charming, has very reasonable rates, has a great location (two blocks from Pike Place) and appealing staff. It is a historic hotel but it is well-maintained with nice furniture, good carpets and freshly painted rooms. If you're looking for a luxury hotel this isn't it, however. There's no pool, only one small mirror in the bathroom, you have to park in a parkade across the street, there's no kleenex, hair dryers (maybe if you ask at the desk), wifi in the rooms or alarm clocks. Also, the homeless shelter is on the same block. It's a busy area however, so I never felt unsafe walking around with my two kids. If you value cozy charm, value, and location over luxury, make sure you stay at the Moore!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for our stay”
Reviews.Author: Robogator0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Great location for Pike Place Market, also walking distance to the Space Needle area. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 5th Floor. There was a play going on that night and we could hear the music and the croud, but it didn't last too long. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice staff and central”
Reviews.Author: Silverwake
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites of The Moore hotel during last June, and I must say it's the best I've ever experienced in Seattle. The room was spacious, and so was the bathroom, there was also a living area that could have been more comfortable, but was good enough for us, with a kitchenette and a dining table. The decoration was simple, modern and very nice, combined with some old features, such as the radiators. And it's true that they fold the towels in animal shapes. We had a dog (although my husband believes it was a rabbit... whatever... it was puppy, believe me :P). The location is perfect to go out at night, to go shopping during the day, and it´s only a couple of blocks away from the seafront and the market, and a short walk to the EMP, International fountain, Space needle, etc. The parking is a block away, and it's 12$/night. You can request a card in the hotel to request in/out privileges. BUT! it closes at midnight and opens again at 7, so if you're going to be late at night, you better take a cab to avoid having to park on the street. Back to the hotel, the staff was very helpful and friendly at all times. The only rude person we met was the bartender of the bar next to the hotel, but we're unsure whether it belongs to The Moore or not.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury European hotel feel at budget hotel prices.”
Reviews.Author: lkoxford
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel’s location, ambiance, and value for the price simply can’t be beat. My husband and I loved its easy access from the airport via the light rail, and were equally delighted by the short walking distance from the hotel to the original Starbucks Café, Pike Place Market, Westlake Center and the monorail to the Space Needle, and other major shopping and tourist attractions. The hotel has been recently renovated but retains its wonderful Beaux Arts character. We particularly loved the building’s tilework, wooden doors and balustrades, decorative artwork in its interior hallways, and tasteful elegance of its guestrooms. The lobby offers free wi-fi connection, and is a charming and comfortable space to work or socialize. Our sixth floor room was spacious, spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable, and had been tastefully updated without losing its vintage character and upscale European feel. The paneled oak door, which opened with a real key, led into a generously sized sitting and dining area with a small kitchenette, with the bedroom and bathroom just beyond. The room appeared to have been freshly painted and furnished, and was beautifully appointed with all the typical amenities (coffee maker, hairdryer, etc.). Although not air-conditioned, opening and closing the two large windows provided satisfactory “climate control.” The historic Moore Theater (next door) featured a performance by Steve Earle the night we were there, but we noticed no noise even with the windows open and slept very well. We enthusiastically and unreservedly recommend this boutique hotel as the ideal place to stay in downtown Seattle. The staff members were friendly, helpful, and provided an extraordinary level of customer service. For example, we were boarding the cruise ship when I suddenly realized I had left my parka in the hotel lobby when we checked out. I telephoned the hotel in a panic, and a staff member jumped in his car and tracked me down at the pier, jogged up to me with a cheerful smile and my parka in hand, and tried to refuse the money I offered him in compensation for his time, trouble, and expense. Four days later as I stood on the deck of the cruise ship in the rain on our approach to Sawyer Glacier, comfortably wrapped in my lined parka, I was extremely grateful that we had chosen to stay at the Moore and for the hotel staff’s exceptional commitment to excellence in service. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location!”
Reviews.Author: alvinator87
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Downtown Seattle, within 2 blocks of Pike Place Market and the light rail station for Sea-Tac, the service was friendly and helpful. Bus directions were clear and concise, and lobby staff were professional without being aloof. Shame about the lack of Wifi in-room, but the lounge (where access is available) is very pleasant to sit in. Rooms are by no means luxurious - but unless you're used to being pampered at 5-star Hilton Resorts, you'll find everything you need! Afterall, who spends that much time on holiday in their hotel room, anyway? All-in-all, an excellent stay, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “really odd, but worth a look”
Reviews.Author: misterfisher2006
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at The Moore on a Thursday night and the following Sunday night. The first night was a lovely room on the 6th floor, unfortunately freshly painted, but quiet and comfortable. Wonderful tub with a shower. The second night was an odd room on the 3rd floor that was comfortable, and quiet, but much too large for the amount of furniture and with a shower, no tub, though there was certainly room for one or two. There is no A/C at this hotel, which is not usually a problem in Seattle, and no clock radio, either. It is located right downtown, which is good and bad. You're just up the street from Pike Market, and just around the corner from the homeless shelter service program. Staff was wonderfully warm and helpful, and I would stay again, but I would not recommend it to my single female or married friends -- just too much functional and not enough vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool old hotel, awesome decor, great deal”
Reviews.Author: krismsulli
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel has a really great vibe to it - a cool old building, great location, very friendly staff, great decor, etc. I stayed with a friend while in Seattle for a conference. The beds were very comfortable, the room spacious, and there was a good view. The only con.s for me were that 1. there's only one key per room (actual key, not key card) so we had to switch off who was responsible for that, which was tricky at times - although we could leave the key with the front desk as needed, and 2. the wireless internet was unavailable in my room - it was one of those things that maybe if your computer was positioned just right in just the right corner of the hallway or something you could get it, but mostly no. I was able to connect just fine for free in the lobby (which was comfortable and well decorated). A minor concern in addition was that my reservation didn't appear when I checked in - they were having some sort of computer problem that day. It was resolved quickly and the staff were really friendly through the process. Again, the location is wonderful - a quick walk to tons of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc., you're right over Pike Place, etc. I would definitely stay here again, especially considering the great price! PS: There were no shows going on during my stay so I can't speak to the noise from the music venue. Our room was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: mgiblin
Reviews.Content: This could be a charming stop in Seattle: the location is outstanding, and the period building with wooden doors and real keys took us back to the 30's. However, the total absence of expected amenities was a surprise: no tissues, no shampoo, no clock, no coffee (even in the lobby), no computer access except the one on the front desk--the feel was of a disinterested and disengaged management.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Mooreshouldbenomore
Reviews.Content: People are nice until you pay them, which you cannot do without an ID or credit card.... be warned. Don't stay here unless u want to spend three or four times what they are saying they will charge.

Reviews.Title: “OK in cool weather”
Reviews.Author: musicmary
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Moore Hotel in May. The price is affordable and the rooms are spacious and very clean. The beds were also very comfortable. So that's most important. The location is also good - short walk to Pike's Market and it's the last stop on the Light Rail from the airport. Our only problem was the street noise if we wanted the windows open at night. There are no ceiling fans and the rooms do get stuffy. Though we were on the 6th floor, the traffic noise was bothersome. We could clearly hear drunk folks talking very loudly. I suppose if you are a deep sleeper it would not be a problem. Fortunately I had good earplugs with me, otherwise I would not have slept. I would not consider staying there in warmer weather though.

Reviews.Title: “The Moore Hotel Rocks !”
Reviews.Author: KurtCobain7777
Reviews.Content: If you drive a Lexus and your wife has had expensive augmented surgery, you'll likely not like this hotel. But if you live in the real world, it's awesome !!! beds were VERY comfortable, shower was perfect. Toilet was great! View was great. TV worked and rug was clean. Staff were friendly and knowlegable. Eco friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Deal in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DukeCityDog
Reviews.Content: I say best hotel deal in Seattle because Seattle is a pricey hotel town and the Moore is great for a budget minded traveler. The Moore isn't fancy but it is clean and the location is fantastic. I'll stay there again absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: peb2011
Reviews.Content: Good location. A little bit noisy because of the street but ok. A suite with 2 queen beds and a kitchenet. The objective was to have dinner and breakfast in the room with young children. No door between the 2 bedrooms. Very good beds. A good choice for the price and the location in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when seeing a show, close to the Market.”
Reviews.Author: skwscrod
Reviews.Content: Excellent price for the location, just blocks away from the the Market. The room had everything you need, and parking was very reasonable with the hotel discount. Very convenient walking next door for the wshow at the theater, and the hotel was quiet. Just wish there was more water pressure in the shower and Internet access in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice to discover the city”
Reviews.Author: Sostraone
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel with affordable price to discover this city. The room are big, clean with a small touch of outdating but some are renovated. In the same time you don't pass the day in your room so it's a good deal for this city.

Reviews.Title: “The price you pay for a bathroom”
Reviews.Author: amy3608
Reviews.Content: Hahaha. So I booked a room with two double beds for me and 3 of my friends online. And when we got there we didn't have a bathroom in our room, it was down the hall. And there wasn't an option for a bathroom online that I remember. And the room we got was tiny! So we asked the front desk and they were happy to accommodate us for only ten dollars more we got our bathroom, and a MUCH bigger room. But aside from that. Everything you need is right by the hotel! Parking was cheap, After the hotel discount. And the hotel was beautiful. The bathroom and the first room were a minor setback.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: christie135
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel is close to everything that is nice in Seattle, I admit, but forget about sleeping if you stay there... The hotel was built around the Moore Theatre and every second day a rock band is playing there.. it is really noisy as the walls are paper-thin.. The rooms are small and cold, but the staff can give you a heater if you ask for it, so that's okay. Overall: stay there, if you don't want to pay a lot and if you care about the location only. If you have greater expectations, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to hotel for Seattle from now on”
Reviews.Author: la_blue_girl2
Reviews.Content: The Moore Hotel was able to do a great job accomodating our large party. It was my friend's 40th birthday and the last weekend of the Picasso exhibit at SAM, and we decided to come to Seattle to do some sightseeing and partying as well as taking in the exhibit. The front desk guy was very friendly and helpful, and gave me a room on the same floor as my other friends. They got me ice from the bar when the ice machine on the second floor was empty, and even let me use the bathroom hours after we had checked out. They let us store our luggage in a locked room behind the front desk after we had checked out (no worries about theft from the car as we went to breakfast and the museum). All in all, they were very accomodating. The room was very bare-bones, but clean. The rooms retain a lot of 19th century details like high ceilings and big windows that open. The bathrooms have been remodeled. Our bathroom had a shower and no bathtub, but my friends' room had a lovely clawfoot tub. There were no refrigerator, microwave, or coffee pot in the rooms, which I would have liked to have. It was sort of a bother to have to keep running down to the ice machine on the 2nd floor, especially when it ran out of ice. There were plenty of cups, towels, shower caps, soap, etc. The beds seemed a little too soft to me, but I am used to sleeping on a really firm bed. We were on the 4th floor and didn't hear any noise from the street or the bar below. It's really a pretty quiet area, almost abandoned on a Saturday night. The location is really great. We were able to walk to several bars and restaurants, Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum. Cab rides to Capitol Hill were cheap (7 or 8 dollars) and we could have walked there as well, had it not been raining. I would say the neighborhood is not the best. There were lots of panhandlers and homeless people coming to ask us for money, cigarettes, etc. I was a little afraid of being pickpocketed when I was at Pike Place Market because there were crowds of tourists and also some sketchy-looking people hanging around. This is not a reflection on the hotel, it just seems like in any tourist area people come around to prey on the tourists. The Nite Lite Lounge downstairs is a cool dive bar. Cheap strong drinks, friendly staff, and greasy bar food, what more could you want? The bar is really big (several rooms) and has a fireplace, which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great rates, great fun!”
Reviews.Author: huskers59
Reviews.Content: Room was quiet and very nice, old hotel many rooms recently remodeled. Walking distance to many local attractions. Reminds me of european hotes I've stayed at. Had large group and everyone was happy with their stays! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Drunken brawl all until 6am....”
Reviews.Author: rv_126
Reviews.Content: This place is the worst hotel I ever stayed in. My wife and I got into town to catch a show in town we had tickets for. When we first arrived at the hotel and got into our room I sensed that this place was trouble but since it seemed quiet - 6pm at the time - and we drove all day to get to Seattle; we decided to try it out and get some rest. We went to bed at about 9pm because we were exhausted but did not get much sleep because we were awaken by the neighbor's blasting there music and drinking and yelling at about 9:30pm. The walls are paper thin so you can hear every word the people in the next room were saying - or should I say yelling. It sounded like there was 20 people in the room all talking at the same time and drunk and loud. The real insanity started at about 1am when a couple of men started arguing loudly and began threatening each other. They then began to fight in an obvious physical brawl that carried out into the hall, complete with screaming girlfriends and death threats the sounds of a bottles breaking in the room while the brawl continued out in the hall. The fight eventually de-escalated but now the drunks decided to 'talk about it' out in the hall in front of our door. The people who were still in the room decided to put on gangster rap music full blast until approx. 6 am before it stopped. My wife and I did not sleep a wink the whole night and the next morning when we approached the girl behind the desk and explain to her why we not be returning the next night - or ever for that matter - she said she is used to dealing with drunks in the halls and really enjoys yelling at them when that sort of thing happens there. The insinuation was obvious - this type of activity is not uncommon at this hotel. THIS PLACE IS A DUMP AND A DRUNKEN FLOPHOUSE!! Do yourself a favor and spend the few extra bucks and go to a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: valfrnandz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a convenient, low-cost old hotel. The place is a bit the worse for wear but clean and quiet. The staff seemed a bit confused however, gave me the wrong room key then argued with me for several minutes before providing the correct key. The rooms were relatively spacious considering the age of the place and cost per night. Plenty of clean towels were provided and the water-pressure and water-heat were impressive. I had a nice stay and enjoyed this very walkable area of the city. There was no cell phone coverage or internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “very old building, basic no frills hotel. try to get a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: cl361
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a single room on the 4th floor. Looking through the pictures on Tripadvisor and their website, it seems that some rooms are more updated or renovated, while others are not. Unfortunately, my room was not. It is a very old building, with that old, musty smell. My bathroom had old, cracked tiles, a sink with a separate hot water and cold water faucet, and a shower with horrible water pressure. The carpet is that standard industrial grade carpet. Although the room seemed clean enough, the worn down appearance of it just felt old and dirty. The hotel seems to have a ton of rooms, and was not full at all when I was there. I would recommend asking for a renovated room if possible. The pros: very affordable (but you get what you pay for), great location just blocks away from the market, waterfront, and easy access to the light rail if you're coming from SEA-TAC airport. Very quiet, although my room was facing the street, there was minimal street noise and I slept quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Best Location”
Reviews.Author: EnviroSci
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and glad we stayed. I love the Pike Place Market and you can't get any closer for under $100 a night. And they validate parking so it was only $12 for almost 24 hours. The hotel is of course OLD but we like the way it has been renovated and the features such as windows that open. It was great to be so close to the market. We had a great dinner at the Virginia Inn, breakfast at Baaco's, and lunch at Lowell's in the Market. We noticed lots of young people and Europeans and other foreigners at the Moore. It definitely is not typical but so worth the price for the location. We would stay there again. There is a wonderful small Catholic church next door also. A really interesting neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for Your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: Gsadueste
Reviews.Content: Best hotel location in Seattle! If you're looking for a place just to sleep that's close proximity and has all amenities in the neighborhood, stay here. It's definitely close to Pike Place Market (5min walk), close to all bus stations, nearby bars and most importantly good eats. We basically walked everywhere we needed to go and took the bus if we were too tired. Their bus system is real easy to use. I'm an instant fan and have been raving about this place since.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of everything!”
Reviews.Author: AlishaC_pdx
Reviews.Content: We love to visit Seattle and love the Moore Hotel. It's just a few blocks from Pike Place Market and only a few more blocks from the Piers. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. The hotel is older, but is packed with some great artistic decor. The bar downstairs is a dive, but worth checking out just for the people watching opportunity alone. Beds are cozy, bathrooms are clean. Prices are much better than nearby chains. Plan to visit nearby Ohana Restaraunt (excellent!!) and our new favorite bar, Bathtub Gin. We've even stayed here for a few Seahawks games. You can catch the bus nearby, or walk the mile to the stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms worn out. Not clean”
Reviews.Author: Jenshall
Reviews.Content: We hadn't planned on staying on this hotel, so we hadn't read any reviews, just bumped into the hotel and needed a place to stay. Not happy with the stay. The rooms were very worn out. They were not clean. There were noice from the night bar 2 meters down from the 2nd floor window. The high speed wireless internet access did not work. The staff was ok Even though, out of about 20 hotel experiences on the west coast the last couple of years, only one were worse than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Shock, then Awe”
Reviews.Author: Kitzy97
Reviews.Content: Arrived at our reserved hotel, The Moore, on our first night in Seattle. Right off, we had a car, so parking might have been an issue, but we always parked after 9 at night and were gone before 8 am, so on street parking was free. Otherwise there was a $12 all day parking lot very close by. We were traveling with my sister and her daughter. They were staying at the plush Sheraton for a conference. Since we were not going to be in the room alot, we didn't want to pay the $360 per night that the Sheraton was asking. Hence, we booked a room at The Moore. After dropping off my sister and her daughter at the Sheraton and seeing their plush room, coming to the Moore was shocking. It is an older type hotel - like something you'd find in an older section of Europe. when we checked in at 10:30 p.m., the lobby was dimly lit, but I did notice beautiful furniture and artwork. Also, there was a disco next door of some sort with loud music. I was just beside myself. Then we took the elevator up to the top floor for our room - again, when I switched on the lite I was grimacing. It was your very basic room. I quickly realized that it was "dim" because they were using CFL lightbulbs (good for them!), so it quickly got much brighter. The first night I didn't know what to expect, but we were there for four nights so I was going to make the best of it. It quickly grew on us and by the end of our stay, I downright liked it. The walls were tastefully painted, it was clean, although old. The bathroom was very clean and spacious. It had a great view out the window. It was not hot or stuffy. The exterior hallways had nice artwork and were clean. And every night when we came back to our room, we couldn't wait to see what new animal shape the maid had created out of our towels and left them artfully on our very comfy bed. Yes, maid service! My sister didn't even get that at the Sheraton!. So, even though a bit shocking start, we really liked this hotel, the location was fabulous (although it is in a so-so neighborhood, so caution is in order), parking was easy and everything turned out fine. Can't beath the price in downtown Seattle and I'm sure we could have done a lot worse. Oh, and the free internet terminal in the lobby was INVALUABLE!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Gem close to the Heart! of Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: NCsleepy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no looker. It is a beautiful old historic hotel with a european style and feel. The staff were helpful, and nice. the location to everything, was perfect. we ended up coming back and staying one more night before flying out the following evening, got a suite and it is roomie, with three rooms,one bath with some toilet issues, and not enough plugs to charge computer, phone, and camera. we would use this hotel again, because of the location alone, and the cost for it. a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “great value excellent locations”
Reviews.Author: DavidS37
Reviews.Content: I think you will either love or hate this hotel - I loved it. You can't beat the location and value for money - close to Pike Place Market and the shopping district. You can walk most places and close to monorail for Space Needle and buses in centre are free if you need one. Okay so its very dated and the paint is peeling on the walls but the room was a good size and had a nice bathroom. Only a fan but with the weather in Seattle that's not a major issue. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Think 'clean, funky and cheap' in downtown Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: JMAChicago
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a no-frills, inexpensive and quirky hotel in the heart of downtown Seattle, look no further. This place fits the bill. The rooms are large, the furniture is kind of funky, and the staff are friendly. It seems like a safe place, and it was clean. If you want to be within about three blocks of Pike Place Market, but don't want to spend a lot on a room, and you don't mind not having air conditioning, and no coffee maker in the room, this place is perfect. The only serious negative I can think of is that the sound insulation is terrible. There were people laughing loudly in the room next to us very early in the morning, and it woke us up.
